alert.note: Alert for Escambia; Santa Rosa (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 27 at 1:24PM EDT until April 27 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Escambia County in northwestern Florida... Southern Santa Rosa County in northwestern Florida... * Until 330 PM CDT. * At 1224 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Ferry Pass, Pace, Milton, Bagdad, Pea Ridge, Floridatown, Ward Basin, Pine Bluff, Galt City, Harp, Mulat, Broxson, Garcon Point, Harold and Parkerville. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
